channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: German president says US is destroying world order
item.description:
German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier has strongly criticised the U.S. foreign policy under President Donald Trump and urged the world not to let the world order disintegrate into a "den of robbers" where the unscrupulous take what they want.
In unusually strong remarks, which

item.title: Israel hits Gaza launch site following failed rocket fire
item.description: The Israeli military said that it identified a failed rocket launch from near Gaza City on Thursday and subsequently struck the launch site. A Hamas source said the group was checking the Israeli allegation.

item.title: US seizes Russian-flagged tanker as Trump widens oil push
item.description: The US seized two Venezuela-linked oil tankers in the Atlantic Ocean on Wednesday, one sailing under Russia's flag, as part of President Donald Trump's aggressive push to dictate oil flows in the Americas and force Venezuela's socialist government to become an ally. After capturing Venezuelan Pres

item.title: US flexes air power in Maduro extraction mission
item.description: The extraction of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife on Saturday showcased US air dominance, deploying stealth fighters to control the skies, jets to jam enemy air defences, and covert reconnaissance drones and satellites to feed commanders real-time intelligence. The Defense

item.title: US Senate to vote on reining in Trump on Venezuela
President Petro’s clash with Trump over Venezuela backs Colombia into a corner
Venezuela under Maduro shipped gold worth $5.2 billion to Switzerland
A third of Americans support US strike on Venezuela, Reuters poll finds
Nicolas Maduro at US court to face drug charges
Venezuela's interim president offers US cooperation
Venezuela’s Maduro sits in US custody as loyalists vow defiance
US lifts Caribbean airspace curbs after attack on Venezuela
Brazil says US crossed 'unacceptable line' over military strikes on Venezuela
Venezuela vice president Rodriguez in Russia, four sources say
Venezuela’s oil facilities unscathed in US strike, sources say
US imposes 1pc tax on cash and money order remittances
Israel says Lebanon is not doing enough to disarm Hezbollah
item.description: Israel said Lebanon's efforts to disarm Hezbollah are far from sufficient after the Lebanese army declared that it had established operational control in the south, raising pressure on Lebanese leaders who fear Israel could escalate strikes. In line with US demands, the Lebanese government has bee

item.title: Pakistan, Saudi in talks on JF-17 jets-for-loans deal
item.description: Pakistan and Saudi Arabia are in talks to convert about $2 billion of Saudi loans into a JF-17 fighter jet deal, two Pakistani sources said, deepening military cooperation months after the two nations signed a mutual defence pact last year. The talks underscore how the two allies are moving to ope

item.title: Pakistan eyes defence pact with Bangladesh, sale of JF-17 jets
item.description: The air force chiefs of Pakistan and Bangladesh held talks on a potential pact covering the sale of JF-17 Thunder fighter jets to Dhaka, Pakistan's military said, as Islamabad widens its arms supply ambitions and beefs up ties with Bangladesh. The talks in Islamabad come as Pakistan looks to capit

item.title: Magnitude 6.7 earthquake strikes near Baculin, Philippines
item.description: A 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck off the Philippines' southern islands on Wednesday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) said, and there were no immediate reports of damage or injuries. USGS said the quake struck at a depth of 10 km (6 miles) around 68 km (42 miles) east of Baculin, a village in the

item.title: India-Bangladesh ties will strengthen after normalcy restores post elections, Jaishankar says
item.description: India expects neighbourly relations in the region to grow stronger once the situation in Bangladesh normalises through elections, Indian External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said. He expressed the hope while responding to a question about his recent visit to Bangladesh at an event in Chennai

item.title: Pakistan court sentences journalists to life over links to protests after Imran Khan’s arrest
item.description: A Pakistani anti-terrorism court sentenced eight journalists and social media commentators on Friday to life imprisonment in absentia after convicting them of terrorism-related offences linked to online activity in support of jailed former prime minister Imran Khan. The convictions stem from cases

item.title: Contaminated water kills nine and hospitalises 200 in India's Indore city
item.description: At least nine people have died, and more than 200 have been hospitalised in the central Indian city of Indore after a diarrhoea outbreak that officials said was linked to contaminated drinking water, according to a lawmaker and local health authorities. Kailash Vijayvargiya, a lawmaker, said nine

item.title: China's Xi to host South Korea's Lee in New Year amid Japan tensions
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will host South Korean President Lee Jae Myung on a state visit starting on Sunday, signalling Beijing's intent to strengthen ties with Seoul amidst strained relations with Japan over Taiwan. The visit marks the second meeting between Xi and Lee in just two months, an

item.title: Myanmar junta says voter turnout at 52pc in first phase of election
item.description: Myanmar's junta said slightly more than half of eligible voters cast their ballot in the first phase of a three-stage national election at the weekend, a figure that was markedly lower than the previous two elections. The election is the first since a 2021 coup and is taking place during a civil w

item.title: India's domination of global rice trade stokes looming water crisis
item.description: When India overtook China as the world's largest producer of rice this year, the country's politicians and agriculture lobby marked the moment by praising resilient farmers and innovative government policy. India has nearly doubled the amount of rice it exported over the past decade, with shipment

item.title: Hamas confirms death of spokesman of its military wing
item.description: Hamas' armed wing, the Al-Qassam Brigades, announced on Monday that its military spokesperson Abu Obeida had been killed during the Israeli offensive on the Gaza Strip. The announcement was made by a newly-appointed spokesperson, who assumed the same nom de guerre, Abu Obeida, during a televised p

item.title: Iraq parliament elects Halbousi as speaker in first post-election session
item.description: Iraq's parliament elected Sunni Muslim lawmaker Haibat al-Halbousi as speaker at its opening session on Monday following November's national election, launching a process to form a new government that often takes months. A parliamentary statement said Halbousi secured 208 out of a total of 283 vot
